alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 6:55PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may be impassable due to elevated stream flows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 PM MST, High flow was recorded on the Sonoita Creek in Patagonia earlier due to heavy rainfall from thunderstorms. This flow should be working its way down Sonoita Creek to Patagonia Lake. - Sonoita Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Patagonia Lake State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
